body:
Yep. Getting harder and harder to tell what's real anymore. A good rule of thumb I've stuck to over the years which has kept my head above water so far, I think, is continuously engaging in critical thinking and having a healthy appreciation and respect for science/medicine. Learning and practicing good critical thinking is one of the pillars of keeping grounded to reality almost regardless of what is going on around you, even when society starts to descend into lunacy as it has been. 

The scientific method is about one of the only ways we have of determining what is real and true and what is nonsense, so that's a good place to start when you're unsure about anything. Ask yourself, what's the science behind it, if any? Don't listen to pundits or blowhards or random users on social media, listen to experts, people with years of extensive, quality training and experience in their respective fields. Again, though, those are just starting points.
body_html:
Yep. Getting harder and harder to tell what's real anymore. A good rule of thumb I've stuck to over the years which has kept my head above water so far, I think, is continuously engaging in critical thinking and having a healthy appreciation and respect for science/medicine. Learning and practicing good critical thinking is one of the pillars of keeping grounded to reality almost regardless of what is going on around you, even when society starts to descend into lunacy as it has been.

The scientific method is about one of the only ways we have of determining what is real and true and what is nonsense, so that's a good place to start when you're unsure about anything. Ask yourself, what's the science behind it, if any? Don't listen to pundits or blowhards or random users on social media, listen to experts, people with years of extensive, quality training and experience in their respective fields. Again, though, those are just starting points.

body:
Today the media has turned away from reporting objective reality towards reporting on two separate Political Disney World narratives.  We decide whether we belong to the red or the blue camp, and then we get our media universe wherein the other side are literally Nazis or literally Communists.  We get cordoned off into our side's echo chambers and cannot comprehend anything else, and therefore we cannot imagine there being anything other than two viewpoints in politics (full Republican conservative or full Democrat progressive).  Nuance is drowned out by hysteria.

Meanwhile, we allow actual modern tyranny like the atrocities in Australia and New Zealand to creep into our modern Western democracies because we're so busy foaming at the mouth about our political opponents.

parent.body:
Yep. Getting harder and harder to tell what's real anymore. A good rule of thumb I've stuck to over the years which has kept my head above water so far, I think, is continuously engaging in critical thinking and having a healthy appreciation and respect for science/medicine. Learning and practicing good critical thinking is one of the pillars of keeping grounded to reality almost regardless of what is going on around you, even when society starts to descend into lunacy as it has been. 

The scientific method is about one of the only ways we have of determining what is real and true and what is nonsense, so that's a good place to start when you're unsure about anything. Ask yourself, what's the science behind it, if any? Don't listen to pundits or blowhards or random users on social media, listen to experts, people with years of extensive, quality training and experience in their respective fields. Again, though, those are just starting points.

body:
>is there anyway to be informed beyond your immediate experience that is truthful?

In a lot of these areas there is no one objective truth. My suggestion is to forget the idea that there is truth to be found. Instead your best bet is to find your own truth on an issue - the position that you think will lead to the best outcome for the situation.

You can do this by keeping an open mind, examining all sides of an issue, and forming your own opinion. Don't get caught up in choosing one side over another, there's always more to an issue than "A vs B". If there wasn't, we wouldn't be arguing about it.
body_html:
is there anyway to be informed beyond your immediate experience that is truthful?

In a lot of these areas there is no one objective truth. My suggestion is to forget the idea that there is truth to be found. Instead your best bet is to find your own truth on an issue - the position that you think will lead to the best outcome for the situation.

You can do this by keeping an open mind, examining all sides of an issue, and forming your own opinion. Don't get caught up in choosing one side over another, there's always more to an issue than "A vs B". If there wasn't, we wouldn't be arguing about it.

body:
Not the guy above, but it's a lot like mindfulness in meditation. Being 'in the moment' so to speak. For me, it helps to constantly ask myself questions about what is going on around me. Why would an employer do that? What benefit would this have for that person? Why would a politician position themselves that way? How could money be made from this? What do I not know about this subject? Do I have a personal bias about this? Have I considered the other side? What do I feel about this problem, or issue? 

Learning to question things that are granted, learning to see the argument from your opponent's side, and thousands of other things I've picked up in my decades on earth are very helpful. And it's a fun mental exercise to do throughout the day, and I find it wards off stress pretty well. 

A good example is everyone at my workplace is furious about these workers who are being paid a king's ransom to come in because we are short staffed, especially when many people already there perceive that they are not paid enough in the pandemic. Often, that's where they get stuck. They don't think beyond that. Probably, the way the organization's finances are, it's probably not coming out of our labor budget to bring these people on in the crisis, because the money isn't 'counted' the simplistic way my co-workers think it is. Or it's a tax write off. Or it's part of a stimulus program. It's probably cheaper to have these people come in, rather than increase pay for our positions in order to retain more employees at our level - at least in the short term. 

So I'm not furious at work everyday, I'm just getting what I need to get out of it in order to move on. But other people, they spend the day drenched in stress hormones, and growing resentments about their position, and wasting energy on shit they don't care to spend ten minutes thinking about. 

But it's honestly not easy to do.

parent.body:
Yep. Getting harder and harder to tell what's real anymore. A good rule of thumb I've stuck to over the years which has kept my head above water so far, I think, is continuously engaging in critical thinking and having a healthy appreciation and respect for science/medicine. Learning and practicing good critical thinking is one of the pillars of keeping grounded to reality almost regardless of what is going on around you, even when society starts to descend into lunacy as it has been. 

The scientific method is about one of the only ways we have of determining what is real and true and what is nonsense, so that's a good place to start when you're unsure about anything. Ask yourself, what's the science behind it, if any? Don't listen to pundits or blowhards or random users on social media, listen to experts, people with years of extensive, quality training and experience in their respective fields. Again, though, those are just starting points.

One of my best friends, someone I previously thought was intelligent and well informed, posted some bullshit about cultural appropriation. So I called her out on it, showed her a video of real native Americans explaining why they don't find it offensive and find it more insulting that the representation they're proud of is being systematically removed by the left. 

Her response? They all have Stockholm syndrome. No joke, that's the kind of bullshit she'll tell herself to avoid confronting her indoctrination. I am so disappointed in what she's become.

post.title: Is anybody else tired of all of the propaganda?

body:
I was just having a conversation with my friend the other day about how the Internet has radically changed since Donald Trump became president. Likely it was starting to head in that direction before his presidency, but that's besides the point. I noticed almost every single major social networking platform is highly political, whether that's by my family, friends, or the website itself partaking in political activism. I used to be able to visit various online communities to find people who interest me to make online friends, but now it seems like I can't go many places online to escape political activism:

- Twitch. Can't even enjoy gaming without some political undertones.
- Facebook. Nonstop Donald Trump and anti-Republican memes, posts, and rants.
- Twitter. Same as Facebook.
- Discord. Even the smaller niche communities just want to talk about politics.
- Reddit. Most of the top and popular subs are political, and the ones that weren't have become political.
- Ruqqus. Mainly politics...
- Youtube. Google pushes politics on their platform, but you can find non-political content.
- Mainstream media. Non-stop anti-Trump and anti-Republican commentary.

It's to a point now where people online get paid for being political activist, as "popular moralizing Tweets" have become a career for them. It has manifested in almost every single online community or entertainment source that you can think of, and I'm surprised that people haven't become burned out on all of the activism and onslaught of propaganda.
body_html:
I was just having a conversation with my friend the other day about how the Internet has radically changed since Donald Trump became president. Likely it was starting to head in that direction before his presidency, but that's besides the point. I noticed almost every single major social networking platform is highly political, whether that's by my family, friends, or the website itself partaking in political activism. I used to be able to visit various online communities to find people who interest me to make online friends, but now it seems like I can't go many places online to escape political activism:

  • Twitch. Can't even enjoy gaming without some political undertones.
  • Facebook. Nonstop Donald Trump and anti-Republican memes, posts, and rants.
  • Twitter. Same as Facebook.
  • Discord. Even the smaller niche communities just want to talk about politics.
  • Reddit. Most of the top and popular subs are political, and the ones that weren't have become political.
  • Ruqqus. Mainly politics...
  • Youtube. Google pushes politics on their platform, but you can find non-political content.
  • Mainstream media. Non-stop anti-Trump and anti-Republican commentary.

It's to a point now where people online get paid for being political activist, as "popular moralizing Tweets" have become a career for them. It has manifested in almost every single online community or entertainment source that you can think of, and I'm surprised that people haven't become burned out on all of the activism and onslaught of propaganda.

body:
That's the point of the propaganda; it's a self-fulfilling prophecy with the sole intent of compelling Americans to kill each other so that the parties pushing that shit can benefit.

I used to be an SJW, and looking at it all from the outside, at both sides of the equation, how they're being told the other team is out to get them, is fucking terrifying -- and part of the reason why it's terrifying is because **it's true.** Both sides are attacking each other now, with very legitimate grievances against their opponents. Grievances caused by this propaganda compelling both sides to hurt each other. 

Watching them foam at the mouth ready to tear each other apart is fucking terrifying. I legitimately don't know what it was I thought SJWs would do when they said #EatTheRich just like a lot of alt-righters truly have no idea what the more extreme among them truly mean by The Boogaloo. 

And I legitimately don't know what the answer is. Both sides have very legitimate grievances, but getting them to sit down at a table and negotiate might be well-on impossible by now.
body_html:
That's the point of the propaganda; it's a self-fulfilling prophecy with the sole intent of compelling Americans to kill each other so that the parties pushing that shit can benefit.

I used to be an SJW, and looking at it all from the outside, at both sides of the equation, how they're being told the other team is out to get them, is fucking terrifying -- and part of the reason why it's terrifying is because it's true. Both sides are attacking each other now, with very legitimate grievances against their opponents. Grievances caused by this propaganda compelling both sides to hurt each other.

Watching them foam at the mouth ready to tear each other apart is fucking terrifying. I legitimately don't know what it was I thought SJWs would do when they said #EatTheRich just like a lot of alt-righters truly have no idea what the more extreme among them truly mean by The Boogaloo.

And I legitimately don't know what the answer is. Both sides have very legitimate grievances, but getting them to sit down at a table and negotiate might be well-on impossible by now.

parent.body:
That's the point of the propaganda; it's a self-fulfilling prophecy with the sole intent of compelling Americans to kill each other so that the parties pushing that shit can benefit.

I used to be an SJW, and looking at it all from the outside, at both sides of the equation, how they're being told the other team is out to get them, is fucking terrifying -- and part of the reason why it's terrifying is because **it's true.** Both sides are attacking each other now, with very legitimate grievances against their opponents. Grievances caused by this propaganda compelling both sides to hurt each other. 

Watching them foam at the mouth ready to tear each other apart is fucking terrifying. I legitimately don't know what it was I thought SJWs would do when they said #EatTheRich just like a lot of alt-righters truly have no idea what the more extreme among them truly mean by The Boogaloo. 

And I legitimately don't know what the answer is. Both sides have very legitimate grievances, but getting them to sit down at a table and negotiate might be well-on impossible by now.

post.title: Is anybody else tired of all of the propaganda?

body:
>What are the left's legitimate grievances?

Basically the shit that happened to them in the 80's/90's that older generations ignored or told them to get over because they feared dealing with them would collapse their communities.

You know those #MeToo folks who have come out of the woodwork? Most of them actually are not lying. That's why they're so insistent that they be believed -- the vast majority actually are real, legit rape and domestic abuse survivors who are telling the truth but can't prove their story, but still want/need justice to be able to recover from what happened to them. They were told repeatedly throughout their lives to get over it, because openly exposing the rapists/child molesters/abusers who hurt them would create a huge civil rights problem that our legal system is not properly equipped to address at all. 

We have a system that relies on proof over consensus, but that system doesn't take into account behind-closed-door crimes for which a victim is either woefully unprepared to or is physically incapable of collecting evidence/proof that what happened to them really happened. All they have to go on is their credibility which is easily torn into shreds in court. It's so easily torn to shreds because, under the surface, most people in their communities are aware of this and they know that if that rapist is punished on the basis of little to no evidence that it would set an ugly precedent which would carry us down the road to where we are now. That's why they would tell rape and abuse victims to just get over it -- they valued the stability of the community more than the lives of these people, and so purposefully and willingly sacrificed rape and abuse victims to preserve the stability of liberal democracy. 

That's why SJWs are so authoritarian and it's why they deconstruct the American legal and philosophical system so much, and it's why they frame what they're doing as progress and claim civil/human rights are anachronistic: in their minds, it IS progress because they're addressing a very real flaw in our legal system. 

They just can't see that they're addressing that flaw in the most ass way possible.

>My grievances with the left are that they actively hate this country, want to destroy it, want to take things that don't belong to them, and openly call for the death of my race and gender. These are mainstream left things. I do not see equivalent bullshit in the mainstream right, and I'm damn close to center, not some alt-right, Jew hating asshole.

The same nuances exist among the left and they perceive the center and the right in the same way. Since, like I said above, this is all based entirely on their childhood experiences from the 80's and 90's, they still think the rest of the world holds the anachronistic and bigoted views people held back in those times, and it's those views they're fighting against. They literally never actually thought or considered that we're in 2020 now and people don't think like that anymore, not because of them but because of the successes of the gay rights movement from the 00's. They're literally fighting spectres from their past because they think that's how the world is now, and most importantly, **they never thought to critically or rationally think about the things they're saying, believing or doing.**

Most of what they believe about the right wing is based on lies, and that's because they're being heavily propagandized. Every single redneck joke you've ever seen a liberal make, every time you've ever heard of them label their opponents as white-trash hillbillies that don't know what's good for them, every single time you've heard of them refer to a Southern state in a disparaging way knowing full-well they've either never been to those places or only interacted with back-woods, uneducated, poor white families who they grew up around and came to detest, they are appealing to a racist stereotype, and they're doing that because of decades of negative, racist propaganda that's been fed to them.

They don't see it as propaganda, they don't recognize it as propaganda, **they see it as objective fact.** That's the key to understanding everything an SJW does: they treat everything they are told and everything they believe is an objective fact and that everyone who disagrees with them is just wrong. They are not capable of seeing that their viewpoint is just a subjective opinion like everyone else's, and that's really the main pillar that supports all of their bullshit. Knock that down and you've got them, mostly. The other main pillar are legitimate grievances stemming back from their childhood, for which the only real remedy is revenge since the legal system can't help them.

I guess I can accept that nothing we can create will be perfect, so can live with some flaws.  I prefer the flaws err on the side of not taking away people's rights, personally, and I guess they prefer the opposite?

Thanks for some honest discussion.  It's refreshing to see.

post.title: Is anybody else tired of all of the propaganda?

body:
The propaganda creates two camps: the ones for and against everything that they consider good. Even if you *know* they are wrong and their reference system is nonsensical, as long as they get you to *feel* they are right about the reference, at least, you end up being forced into their "evil"  camp by your own feelings.

For instance, I know those crazy liberals don't really represent or care about black people when they go and destroy other people's carriers and burn their cities, but because I only hear their viewpoint all the time, I end up believing they are right about that. So, since I know what they are doing is wrong but I believe blacks are with them, even if I know that's not the case as a whole, I still resent people that are black, even if most of them are not aware of what's really going on.

We are being segregated and thrown against each other all over the world by those people.

body:
>Interesting. I don't know how it's possible to know if most #MeToo are not lying when there is no proof to be had, but I see what you're talking about with a "flaw" in the justice system. I guess I can accept that nothing we can create will be perfect, so can live with some flaws. I prefer the flaws err on the side of not taking away people's rights, personally, and I guess they prefer the opposite?

It's all good, and your side is the side most people in the world would take until now. The problem is that they only took that side because that's what they were told to do in history class and in their communities, and was never really grounded in actual, first-person experience, so people never really understood why what they were being told was true in a real, personal sense. 

To the SJW, they err on the side of doing away with Blackstone's formulation because the alternative is to allow that flaw to go unaddressed and, in principle, for millions of people to be raped behind closed doors, for millions of children to be molested and abused by their parents or other relatives/neighbors with no real recourse, and what is the point of civil rights, legal systems and justice itself if all that happens when they need it the most is that the very system they were told all their lives would protect them will do nothing but tell them to forgive? That the collective is more important than their own suffering? When the whole point of rights is to prevent people from violating them and punish them when they do anyway? 

The truth is that for civil and moral progress to continue, we need a better legal system and a better system of civil/human rights that take these facts into account. We desperately need a better way of doing things, because we cannot allow innocent people to be thrown in jail for something they didn't do, and we absolutely cannot allow our own people to rape, violate, and abuse each other on a mass scale like what's apparently been happening -- and denying it's happening simply because these people have no proof will do nothing but fuel the fire.

I fear that won't happen though, because the SJWs are sick of it and the right wing is sick of them resorting to every destructive means available to achieve their objective. Both sides are very severely harming the other and neither side can really afford to compromise on the issue because the costs are simply too high. Expecting one side to just suck it up and deal with it simply is not realistic, is not just, and is absolutely cruel. 

Warfare might really be the only realistic end result here, with all of the bloodshed, atrocities, and horrors it entails. And at the end of it, the problem still won't likely be solved because it is a human and an evolutionary one, not a legal one. I greatly fear for the future of this country because of it -- I highly doubt we'll even *be* a country within the next year or two, because of this shit.

The truth is that for civil and moral progress to continue, we need a better legal system and a better system of civil/human rights that take these facts into account. I fear that won't happen though, because the SJWs are sick of it and the right wing is sick of them resorting to every destructive means available to achieve their objective. body:
You aren't entirely wrong. I live in Finland, and a lot of black immigrants have come here in recent years. Since then, the amount of murders rapes and insecuriry in general have increased. Sweden is in similar situation but worse. There are already places where policemen are too afraid to go. And Finland will be in same situation if we don't do anything.

The media in Finland is mostly biased. It downplays the crimes of black people or does not report about them at all. At the same time, they report about small racist hate speech cases. The situation isn't the worst possible, but we still need neutral media.

I'm not saying all black people are bad, but it seems like Finnish media and government treat them much better that whites. In my opinion, if an immigrant commits a serious crime, like a rape or a murder, they should be deported.

Sorry for only talking about the situation of Finland, I'm not too familiar with America's situation other than the 13% 50% thing.

One of my best friends, someone I previously thought was intelligent and well informed, posted some bullshit about cultural appropriation. So I called her out on it, showed her a video of real native Americans explaining why they don't find it offensive and find it more insulting that the representation they're proud of is being systematically removed by the left. 

Her response? They all have Stockholm syndrome. No joke, that's the kind of bullshit she'll tell herself to avoid confronting her indoctrination. I am so disappointed in what she's become.

body:
I'm an extreme centrist. My definition of the boogaloo is pushing the reset button on government. Consider it a "vote of no confidence" with bullets instead of ballots, since the Founders didn't see fit to include a **peaceful** "vote of no confidence" procedure in the Constitution.

My ideal would be to let both extremes, right and left, fight it out, mop up the remains, then hold a new Constitutional Convention. The Constitution 2.0 would look much like the original in structure, with the Bill of Rights and other useful Amendments swept into the main body of the document, along with stiff penalties for enacting laws that violate those provisions.

The chief failure of the current Constitution is that it has no "teeth". If politicians violate it, no big deal. There are no civil, criminal, or adminstrative (e.g.-removal from office) penalties that follow. In fact, they'll probably just change a few words and pass what is essentially the same law **again** and then that law will have to work its way through the court system and likely be declared unConstitutional as well.

This game can be played in perpetuity with no consequences or repercussions to anyone but the citizenry.

The Constitution 2.0 would look much like the original in structure, with the Bill of Rights and other useful Amendments swept into the main body of the document, along with stiff penalties for enacting laws that violate those provisions.

parent.body:
That's the point of the propaganda; it's a self-fulfilling prophecy with the sole intent of compelling Americans to kill each other so that the parties pushing that shit can benefit.

I used to be an SJW, and looking at it all from the outside, at both sides of the equation, how they're being told the other team is out to get them, is fucking terrifying -- and part of the reason why it's terrifying is because **it's true.** Both sides are attacking each other now, with very legitimate grievances against their opponents. Grievances caused by this propaganda compelling both sides to hurt each other.

Yes, per the Geneva Convention. A neutral country is not allowed to sell arms to a nation that is engaged in war. That is taking a side, ergo an action of war. Roosevelt (Who was also owned by jews the same as Churchill) ![](https://files.catbox.moe/uzkfsz.jpg) wanted to give Britain ships and war supplies, but it was illegal. So he came up with "Lend Lease" which circumvented the law, and also scrapped Britain out of everything they held. It was 2006 before Britain finished paying the US off for it's WWII debt. 

The US was supposed to be neutral, the people didn't want war, and Roosevelt (Rosenfeld) didn't have the authority to declare war on his own. That is why he let Pearl Harbor (after instigating it) happen; to anger the people enough to want to support going to war. 

> When did this happen?

Upon England declaring war on Germany. The US was still neutral but did it "in the interest of national security". Similar to how they rounded up Japs and threw them into **concentration camps** around the US. 

> wow i never knew america is currently at war with china, those sanctions and their hidden message

> do you not understand what a convoy escort is? or a trade protection zone?

Germany issued newspaper bulletins, cables, advertisements WARNING the US to STAY OUT of the warzone. They warned it's A WAR ZONE, if you enter it YOU MIGHT GET HIT! But we weren't worried about being attacked, Roosevelt actually wanted that because it would get support for going to war. Instead, US ships sank German submarines. The US acted first, not Germany. This is what the Jewish press will not tell people. 

> then that would mean trump commited treason too, invasion was expected but they didnt know where, 8 battleships sunk just for a war declaration?

Trump attacks the constitution just like Obama, Bush, Clinton, Regan, Carter, ALL OF THEM. Jewish conspirators see the constitution as a major hurdle in subverting this country. It was written in DIRECT OPPOSITION to governmental tyranny, which is what they want. Ever wonder why Israel never gets negative press? Look what they do to black people over there ![](https://files.catbox.moe/p1z7jr.jpg) yet not ONE WORD on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, Wiki, - well, we all know who owns those outlets.

Not whataboutism, it's holding one to their words and actions. If you're going to act, be consistent. If you aren't, you are a hypocrite and a liar, a dishonest person that shouldn't be leading people or holding any political office. The source for the quote is Patton himself. His family released the Patton Papers in 1970, which completely destroyed the US's interests for going to war. It exposed the swindle taking place behind the scenes. 

> allies didnt know about soviet war crimes back then, there was no point in taking berlin as it would go to the soviets anyway, yeah no shit, stalin made puppets to protect his country

Their defection rate was so bad, they assigned a second army "NOT ONE STEP BACK!" for any soldier retreating would be shot on sight by the secondary army. It's not just people he'd be moving, it would have been ALL those resources. Churchill wanted to commit a war crime, this is ignored and it shouldn't be. 

> cough holocaust, war crimes, commando order and SS cough

War crimes, huh? ![](files.catbox.moe/1hmme8.jpg)

Holocaust was a lie disseminated by jewish media. Even a Jew called it out as fake when visiting Auschwitz: ![](https://www.bitchute.com/video/5MDSZQYFoCyY/). David Irving, a British Historian and Author, [debunks the Holocaust in 3 minutes.](https://archive.org/details/DavidIrvingDebunksHolocaustIn3Min)

The SS was a volunteer group. There's been many lies told about it, but what you're not told is that there were Muslim, Arab, Chinese, African, and Slavs that were a part of the SS. ![](https://files.catbox.moe/oxbsrc.JPG). It wasn't a "whites only" club as jew media implies, it was to secure the homogeneus societies of EACH nation, not just Germany. Hitler believed every nation should preserve its people, culture, histories in their own ways. Because it was catching on, and people found pride in their nations and refused to mix with outside breeds; Churchill started agitating for war. Churchill, by the way, was financed by jewish businessmen in an organization called The Focus Group. They owned him. 

> trading military bases for 50 ww1 destroyers = war?

Yes, per the Geneva Convention. A neutral country is not allowed to sell arms to a nation that is engaged in war. That is taking a side, ergo an action of war. Roosevelt (Who was also owned by jews the same as Churchill) ![](https://files.catbox.moe/uzkfsz.jpg) wanted to give Britain ships and war supplies, but it was illegal. So he came up with "Lend Lease" which circumvented the law, and also scrapped Britain out of everything they held. It was 2006 before Britain finished paying the US off for it's WWII debt. 

The US was supposed to be neutral, the people didn't want war, and Roosevelt (Rosenfeld) didn't have the authority to declare war on his own. That is why he let Pearl Harbor (after instigating it) happen; to anger the people enough to want to support going to war. 

> When did this happen?

Upon England declaring war on Germany. The US was still neutral but did it "in the interest of national security". Similar to how they rounded up Japs and threw them into **concentration camps** around the US. 

> wow i never knew america is currently at war with china, those sanctions and their hidden message

Most of that is just smoke to scare us into another world war, nuclear war, etc. etc. "Never let a tragedy go to waste" - Joe Biden. It's more of an act of TREASON because our corrupted politicians (they're ALL corrupt - you don't get to that position today without being corrupt) gave them our jobs and technology which severely WEAKENED us, and STRENGTHENED a COMMUNIST NATION, who would otherwise be starving. 

> do you not understand what a convoy escort is? or a trade protection zone?

Germany issued newspaper bulletins, cables, advertisements WARNING the US to STAY OUT of the warzone. They warned it's A WAR ZONE, if you enter it YOU MIGHT GET HIT! But we weren't worried about being attacked, Roosevelt actually wanted that because it would get support for going to war. Instead, US ships sank German submarines. The US acted first, not Germany. This is what the Jewish press will not tell people. 

> then that would mean trump commited treason too, invasion was expected but they didnt know where, 8 battleships sunk just for a war declaration?

Every US President since Woodrow Wilson has committed treason to some extent. They are merely puppets at this point. Wilson should have hanged for the Federal Reserve Act, Federal Income Tax, and creation of the IRS as it's unconstitutional and gives our livelihoods to a 3rd party alien to this country. Trump attacks the constitution just like Obama, Bush, Clinton, Regan, Carter, ALL OF THEM. Jewish conspirators see the constitution as a major hurdle in subverting this country. It was written in DIRECT OPPOSITION to governmental tyranny, which is what they want. Ever wonder why Israel never gets negative press? Look what they do to black people over there ![](https://files.catbox.moe/p1z7jr.jpg) yet not ONE WORD on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, Wiki, - well, we all know who owns those outlets. 

> again more whataboutism, i dont defend allied war crimes, source for that quote? also no civillian could be considered innocent, you have the volksturm to thank for that

Not whataboutism, it's holding one to their words and actions. If you're going to act, be consistent. If you aren't, you are a hypocrite and a liar, a dishonest person that shouldn't be leading people or holding any political office. The source for the quote is Patton himself. His family released the Patton Papers in 1970, which completely destroyed the US's interests for going to war. It exposed the swindle taking place behind the scenes. 

> allies didnt know about soviet war crimes back then, there was no point in taking berlin as it would go to the soviets anyway, yeah no shit, stalin made puppets to protect his country

Allies DID know about the war crimes, they were ordered to ignore them. We were reading all their communications, we knew their strategy, when they'd act and where. This was true for Germany, Churchill knew BEFOREHAND when London was going to get bombed, they knew via the scout plane checking the weather, radio communication codes being broken in a program called ULTRA, so secret even Churchill's assistant didn't know about it. 

Berlin going to the Soviets anyway? But but that would mean... TREASON was being committed.

parent.body:
I'm an extreme centrist. My definition of the boogaloo is pushing the reset button on government. Consider it a "vote of no confidence" with bullets instead of ballots, since the Founders didn't see fit to include a **peaceful** "vote of no confidence" procedure in the Constitution.

My ideal would be to let both extremes, right and left, fight it out, mop up the remains, then hold a new Constitutional Convention. The Constitution 2.0 would look much like the original in structure, with the Bill of Rights and other useful Amendments swept into the main body of the document, along with stiff penalties for enacting laws that violate those provisions.

The chief failure of the current Constitution is that it has no "teeth". If politicians violate it, no big deal. There are no civil, criminal, or adminstrative (e.g.-removal from office) penalties that follow. In fact, they'll probably just change a few words and pass what is essentially the same law **again** and then that law will have to work its way through the court system and likely be declared unConstitutional as well.

This game can be played in perpetuity with no consequences or repercussions to anyone but the citizenry.

[This story](https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/513201-tennessee-governor-signs-bill-increasing-punishments-for-certain) about the Governor of Tennessee signing a bill into law is making the rounds in the leftist spin machine.

Real version: Some behaviors associated with rioting are now felonies in the State of Tennessee, because unlike Washington and Oregon they're not going to put up with ANTIFA bullshit.

Media spin: "TENNESSEE GOVERNOR SIGNS LAW REMOVING PROTESTORS' RIGHT TO VOTE"

body:
>Basically all the Goyim stuff

yeah every religion has some weird shit in its scripture, particularly abrahamic ones, the bible and the quran are great examples. Does that mean the majority of members of religions actually carry out the violence their scripture advises? No. And Zionism is, like any nationalistic ideology, very dangerous and I do not like it.

In fact, Nazis have a lot more in common with Zionists than you might think. Both are hyper nationalists, support an ethnostate, and see themselves as racially superior. Keep in mind I'm not a centrist, but this is still ridiculous racial pride and identity politics and no one likes that.

>1% are Jews

Okay, I don't hate the 1% anyway so your argument doesn't matter. That's the ridiculous populist mindset you see people on the left constantly using, and is the same mindset that led to communism in the first place. The best way to deal with "racial inequality" is economic exchange that lifts everyone up.

>Nazis invented coercion

never said that, I said they did it a lot more than other people. They had a massive amount of authority and ability to coerce, and coerce they did.

>Jews were slave owners

So you care about the rights of black people! How good of you my friend.

>Diversity and communism

The reason minorities do bad is precisely BECAUSE of welfare, it does the exact opposite of help people. The notion that welfare is a good thing is leftist thinking.

>Two wings of the same bird

The notion that Jews are the sole cause of the duopoly is because Jews have more wealth as you've shown me, it's not a Jewish plot, it's because rich people can afford more lobbyists. This is, again, populist leftist thinking that you are using. Honestly you guys might as well call yourselves nationalist leftists.

Oh wait, you do, national SOCIALIST german WORKERS party. You guys are hypocritical leftists who use identity politics in the same way as the SJWs but you blame it more on race than class. Jeez, blame the commies, look who's talkin'

parent.body:
I was just having a conversation with my friend the other day about how the Internet has radically changed since Donald Trump became president. Likely it was starting to head in that direction before his presidency, but that's besides the point. I noticed almost every single major social networking platform is highly political, whether that's by my family, friends, or the website itself partaking in political activism. I used to be able to visit various online communities to find people who interest me to make online friends, but now it seems like I can't go many places online to escape political activism:

- Twitch. Can't even enjoy gaming without some political undertones.
- Facebook. Nonstop Donald Trump and anti-Republican memes, posts, and rants.
- Twitter. Same as Facebook.
- Discord. Even the smaller niche communities just want to talk about politics.
- Reddit. Most of the top and popular subs are political, and the ones that weren't have become political.
- Ruqqus. Mainly politics...
- Youtube. Google pushes politics on their platform, but you can find non-political content.
- Mainstream media. Non-stop anti-Trump and anti-Republican commentary.

It's to a point now where people online get paid for being political activist, as "popular moralizing Tweets" have become a career for them. It has manifested in almost every single online community or entertainment source that you can think of, and I'm surprised that people haven't become burned out on all of the activism and onslaught of propaganda.

  • Reddit. Most of the top and popular subs are political, and the ones that weren't have become political.
  • Ruqqus. Mainly politics...
  • Youtube. Google pushes politics on their platform, but you can find non-political content.
  • Mainstream media. Non-stop anti-Trump and anti-Republican commentary.

It's to a point now where people online get paid for being political activist, as "popular moralizing Tweets" have become a career for them. It has manifested in almost every single online community or entertainment source that you can think of, and I'm surprised that people haven't become burned out on all of the activism and onslaught of propaganda.

OR you can reject nationalism entirely. Isolationism kills economies, peace saves lives. You need to create a strongly capitalistic and free society based on voluntary exchange. People can put aside their differences in a way that lifts people out of poverty and creates wealth for all people.

Unfortunately, you're preaching a violent and tribalistic ideology that encourages people to blame Jews for their problems instead of trying to work on themselves. It's the lazy leftist thinking that people think the world will somehow be better if we just "killed all the rich people and shared their money around".

It's not just weak, it's genuinely pathetic.

body:
So... what you’re saying is childhood abuse victims are unfit for political and social participation because of the resulting emotional instability, inability to think objectively, and inaccurate worldview that they adopt. That they are the broken individuals that will destroy society with their brokenness?

I agree. 

But, I also think “get over it” is reasonable advice to give them. Go to therapy and deal with it privately. Life just isn’t fair. If the alternative is a nobody gets an important community member sent to jail and that ends up breaking the community, then get over it. Order is more important, more fragile, and more precious than the subjective “justice.” 

That said, pedophiles and the like are terrorists because they breed the broken individuals described above and should be met with contempt and execution. But, not at the expense of order. 

Order is either defended or imposed. Not built. You can’t break order just to pacify mobs or emotional people and expect that to result in some kind of “new” order. Order doesn’t come from chaos - it comes from older order. Once order is all the way gone, you can’t just rebuild it; it has to be imposed by an outside force. So, just keeping order - silencing and snuffing out hints of chaos - in the first place is the more noble action.

 I can’t imagine just deciding to be permanently aggrieved and obsessed with something traumatic rather than choosing to move on from it.

parent.body:
>What are the left's legitimate grievances?

Basically the shit that happened to them in the 80's/90's that older generations ignored or told them to get over because they feared dealing with them would collapse their communities.

You know those #MeToo folks who have come out of the woodwork? Most of them actually are not lying. That's why they're so insistent that they be believed -- the vast majority actually are real, legit rape and domestic abuse survivors who are telling the truth but can't prove their story, but still want/need justice to be able to recover from what happened to them. They were told repeatedly throughout their lives to get over it, because openly exposing the rapists/child molesters/abusers who hurt them would create a huge civil rights problem that our legal system is not properly equipped to address at all. 

We have a system that relies on proof over consensus, but that system doesn't take into account behind-closed-door crimes for which a victim is either woefully unprepared to or is physically incapable of collecting evidence/proof that what happened to them really happened. All they have to go on is their credibility which is easily torn into shreds in court. It's so easily torn to shreds because, under the surface, most people in their communities are aware of this and they know that if that rapist is punished on the basis of little to no evidence that it would set an ugly precedent which would carry us down the road to where we are now. That's why they would tell rape and abuse victims to just get over it -- they valued the stability of the community more than the lives of these people, and so purposefully and willingly sacrificed rape and abuse victims to preserve the stability of liberal democracy. 

That's why SJWs are so authoritarian and it's why they deconstruct the American legal and philosophical system so much, and it's why they frame what they're doing as progress and claim civil/human rights are anachronistic: in their minds, it IS progress because they're addressing a very real flaw in our legal system. 

They just can't see that they're addressing that flaw in the most ass way possible.

>My grievances with the left are that they actively hate this country, want to destroy it, want to take things that don't belong to them, and openly call for the death of my race and gender. These are mainstream left things. I do not see equivalent bullshit in the mainstream right, and I'm damn close to center, not some alt-right, Jew hating asshole.

The same nuances exist among the left and they perceive the center and the right in the same way. Since, like I said above, this is all based entirely on their childhood experiences from the 80's and 90's, they still think the rest of the world holds the anachronistic and bigoted views people held back in those times, and it's those views they're fighting against. They literally never actually thought or considered that we're in 2020 now and people don't think like that anymore, not because of them but because of the successes of the gay rights movement from the 00's. They're literally fighting spectres from their past because they think that's how the world is now, and most importantly, **they never thought to critically or rationally think about the things they're saying, believing or doing.**

Most of what they believe about the right wing is based on lies, and that's because they're being heavily propagandized. Every single redneck joke you've ever seen a liberal make, every time you've ever heard of them label their opponents as white-trash hillbillies that don't know what's good for them, every single time you've heard of them refer to a Southern state in a disparaging way knowing full-well they've either never been to those places or only interacted with back-woods, uneducated, poor white families who they grew up around and came to detest, they are appealing to a racist stereotype, and they're doing that because of decades of negative, racist propaganda that's been fed to them.

They don't see it as propaganda, they don't recognize it as propaganda, **they see it as objective fact.** That's the key to understanding everything an SJW does: they treat everything they are told and everything they believe is an objective fact and that everyone who disagrees with them is just wrong. They are not capable of seeing that their viewpoint is just a subjective opinion like everyone else's, and that's really the main pillar that supports all of their bullshit. Knock that down and you've got them, mostly. The other main pillar are legitimate grievances stemming back from their childhood, for which the only real remedy is revenge since the legal system can't help them.

body:
I think the story was wrong. We need to stop telling people that the government/ law will protect them - that implies that should rely on it like a parent or something.

What we need to understand is that the law is an aid for protecting yourself - it protects you from wrongful retribution. 

Law is there to stop the cycle of violence. If you kill your neighbor because he decided to burglarize you, it stops the neighbors wife from feeling justified in killing you for revenge because of the concept and closure that you are justified in your right to defend your home. And, if she decides to kill you anyway, you will either be justified in killing in self defense or she will be in the wrong and punished accordingly.

Without it, she kills you and your wife kills her and her children kill your wife and so on. The law is there to stop that with the concept of rights violation, punishment, and justification. 

The law is there to rule after you act, not before you act and not to prevent you from being acted upon. That’s why the police have to wait for the guy to kill you before they do anything. That’s the only time the evidence happens. What’s supposed to happen is you’re supposed to kill your aggressor and the court is supposed to rule in your defense. You’re supposed to prevent it yourself or provide a justified response.

parent.body:
>Interesting. I don't know how it's possible to know if most #MeToo are not lying when there is no proof to be had, but I see what you're talking about with a "flaw" in the justice system. I guess I can accept that nothing we can create will be perfect, so can live with some flaws. I prefer the flaws err on the side of not taking away people's rights, personally, and I guess they prefer the opposite?

It's all good, and your side is the side most people in the world would take until now. The problem is that they only took that side because that's what they were told to do in history class and in their communities, and was never really grounded in actual, first-person experience, so people never really understood why what they were being told was true in a real, personal sense. 

To the SJW, they err on the side of doing away with Blackstone's formulation because the alternative is to allow that flaw to go unaddressed and, in principle, for millions of people to be raped behind closed doors, for millions of children to be molested and abused by their parents or other relatives/neighbors with no real recourse, and what is the point of civil rights, legal systems and justice itself if all that happens when they need it the most is that the very system they were told all their lives would protect them will do nothing but tell them to forgive? That the collective is more important than their own suffering? When the whole point of rights is to prevent people from violating them and punish them when they do anyway? 

The truth is that for civil and moral progress to continue, we need a better legal system and a better system of civil/human rights that take these facts into account. We desperately need a better way of doing things, because we cannot allow innocent people to be thrown in jail for something they didn't do, and we absolutely cannot allow our own people to rape, violate, and abuse each other on a mass scale like what's apparently been happening -- and denying it's happening simply because these people have no proof will do nothing but fuel the fire.

I fear that won't happen though, because the SJWs are sick of it and the right wing is sick of them resorting to every destructive means available to achieve their objective. Both sides are very severely harming the other and neither side can really afford to compromise on the issue because the costs are simply too high. Expecting one side to just suck it up and deal with it simply is not realistic, is not just, and is absolutely cruel. 

Warfare might really be the only realistic end result here, with all of the bloodshed, atrocities, and horrors it entails. And at the end of it, the problem still won't likely be solved because it is a human and an evolutionary one, not a legal one. I greatly fear for the future of this country because of it -- I highly doubt we'll even *be* a country within the next year or two, because of this shit.

parent.body:
>is there anyway to be informed beyond your immediate experience that is truthful?

In a lot of these areas there is no one objective truth. My suggestion is to forget the idea that there is truth to be found. Instead your best bet is to find your own truth on an issue - the position that you think will lead to the best outcome for the situation.

You can do this by keeping an open mind, examining all sides of an issue, and forming your own opinion. Don't get caught up in choosing one side over another, there's always more to an issue than "A vs B". If there wasn't, we wouldn't be arguing about it.
parent.body_html:
is there anyway to be informed beyond your immediate experience that is truthful?

You can do this by keeping an open mind, examining all sides of an issue, and forming your own opinion. Don't get caught up in choosing one side over another, there's always more to an issue than "A vs B". If there wasn't, we wouldn't be arguing about it.

post.body: It’s incredible that it’s too much to ask to just be simply informed, everyone out there trying to convince you of something. I’ve grown weary of all of these narratives, subtle and obvious; is there anyway to be informed beyond your immediate experience that is truthful?
post.body_html: It’s incredible that it’s too much to ask to just be simply informed, everyone out there trying to convince you of something. I’ve grown weary of all of these narratives, subtle and obvious; is there anyway to be informed beyond your immediate experience that is truthful?
post.title: Is anybody else tired of all of the propaganda?

body:
>So... what you’re saying is childhood abuse victims are unfit for political and social participation because of the resulting emotional instability, inability to think objectively, and inaccurate worldview that they adopt. That they are the broken individuals that will destroy society with their brokenness?

Congratulations, you're exactly the kind of person they're rebelling against, and you're one of the main causes of the problem.

Every side has important points they're right about in the conflict, and one of the important points the SJWs are right about is that all people in a free country are, in fact, entitled to justice. It doesn't mean we have to do away with Blackstone's formulation or the trial process or any of the absurd bullshit they want to accomplish that end, but it *does* mean that if you want to continue having a country, you're going to have to shed that dismissive attitude of yours and accept that people who are victimized *are* entitled to justice from the state, and actually deal with the inconvenience of innocent people getting closure from their communities. It's the state's *job.* They're literally supposed to be the ones investigating serious crimes like rape, abuse and murder. That's why we have cops :P It's why we have a free country in the first place.

If you want to continue to be able to go to 7/11 and McDonald's, then you need to stop being so selfish and listen to the other side, and be willing to compromise with them.

>Law and order exist for the purpose of establishing justice and when they fail in this purpose they become the dangerously structured dams that block the flow of social progress. -Martin Luther King, Jr.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Given that, let me take the time to address the rationale you offered because breaking it down is going to be crucial to putting a stop to this mess and moving society forward, so, here we go: 

>But, I also think “get over it” is reasonable advice to give them. Go to therapy and deal with it privately. Life just isn’t fair. If the alternative is a nobody gets an important community member sent to jail and that ends up breaking the community, then get over it. Order is more important, more fragile, and more precious than the subjective “justice.”

Well, I mean, aside from that being pretty objectively terrible, it's also a fundamental misrepresentation of how a free country works and even the purpose of a society. If a community is so fragile that it is dependent on literal rapists and murderers to keep itself afloat, then it deserves to be trashed. Justice isn't subjective in a free country, its standard is based on the principles of civil and human rights and on the laws it upholds. That's what we call rule of law. It's where order comes from, and it's solely derived from and based on the consent of the governed, not "older order". You literally can't have order without justice and 2020 is a bloody and fiery safari through why that is. 

Communities in free countries can't be propped up on the shoulders of prominent community members who can, by your reasoning, use their status to get away with doing whatever they want, that's insane. That defeats the purpose of even having a community. 

Justice is always more important than order because it's what makes it possible to have order and peace in the first place. 

Prioritizing the rights of victimized individuals over their abusers is vitally important to protecting order even if you disagree with that specifically to protect the stability of the community anyway. Turns out, allowing community members to rape and abuse and kill each other destabilizes communities and breaks down social order. Who knew

>I can’t imagine just deciding to be permanently aggrieved and obsessed with something traumatic rather than choosing to move on from it.

Well, that's what I mean when I say you need to stop being selfish and learn to emphasize with these people: they're not doing anything wrong by feeling a certain way, and criticizing them for being traumatized is doing nothing but pissing them off even more. Like it or not, there's about 50+ million of them that share this great land and you have to learn to get along with them if you want to continue having a country, and I say that for better or for worse.

parent.body:
So... what you’re saying is childhood abuse victims are unfit for political and social participation because of the resulting emotional instability, inability to think objectively, and inaccurate worldview that they adopt. That they are the broken individuals that will destroy society with their brokenness?

I agree. 

But, I also think “get over it” is reasonable advice to give them. Go to therapy and deal with it privately. Life just isn’t fair. If the alternative is a nobody gets an important community member sent to jail and that ends up breaking the community, then get over it. Order is more important, more fragile, and more precious than the subjective “justice.” 

That said, pedophiles and the like are terrorists because they breed the broken individuals described above and should be met with contempt and execution. But, not at the expense of order. 

Order is either defended or imposed. Not built. You can’t break order just to pacify mobs or emotional people and expect that to result in some kind of “new” order. Order doesn’t come from chaos - it comes from older order. Once order is all the way gone, you can’t just rebuild it; it has to be imposed by an outside force. So, just keeping order - silencing and snuffing out hints of chaos - in the first place is the more noble action.

 I can’t imagine just deciding to be permanently aggrieved and obsessed with something traumatic rather than choosing to move on from it.

I can’t imagine just deciding to be permanently aggrieved and obsessed with something traumatic rather than choosing to move on from it.

body:
If trauma drives them to act this way when they can choose to do otherwise, then they are bad people. No one has to respect people who destroy things just because they personally are broken. Their outrage is no more justified than mine when they run around living in an alternate universe and fucking up everybody else’s ability to live their lives. We do not have to submit to their ridiculous coercion. Feelings are not inherently valid and they do not require one to act on them.

Justice is subjective. Everybody thinks they’re just. Cultures, religions, and individuals differ on what they feel is just. There is no objective “justice.” “Justice” is not a thing that actually exists. There is no “justice” in a state of nature because there are no rights and there are no wrongs.

“Justice” is not the origin of anything. The concept of it is created by contracts and law over time. The idea of justice comes from there first being an order to adhere to. And, our government and society don’t grant people entitlement to “justice” either. Because it’s subjective, people have rights, and their rights to due process trump feelings even if they are guilty in reality.  “Justice” is not something that can be promised and it is not promised.

If it is as you say, then all their behavior is the name of feelings of entitlement to something they are not entitled to and that they were not promised, but instead *felt* as if they were promised.

There is no reason to capitulate to those people because they’re broken and they will never be fixed. If you capitulate to them, they’ll just create an even more fucked up world. We’ve already established that they’re emotionally unstable and cannot think objectively. On top of that, they are authoritarian. People like that do not fit the definition of what makes a human a person - they do not reason. They’re irreparable and there’s no use having them once they’re like that. It’s like when someone gets bit by a zombie - nothing you can do to fix it. They are not just going to come to sense once they get what they want, they will escalate. Maybe, we cannot have a society where so many people are like this - maybe we do just need to go to war and get rid of them.

If these are the kind of broken and inherently destructive people that pedophilia breeds, then we need to treat it as a terrorist attack, a national security threat, treason, and biowarfare. It needs a sentence of death, but what it results in - those broken people - also need to be kept from power and say in society. You, I, and themselves already admit they’re broken and unfit.

Our society is not based on “human rights” - a fake concept where they add a new “right” every month. Our society is based on natural rights - life, liberty, and property - those are the only rights. That’s why society exists - to reduce the frequency of threats to your life, maximize your ability to act without threat of violence, and to stop people from stealing from you. Society exists to provide order because you can only have a right to life, freedom, and your own property if there is order.  The state is not there to provide justice. It’s there to provide and enforce a ruleset within which, you can better play the game of life. Exist for a long time, make good choices, accumulate resources - that’s the objective of the game.

It’s arrogant to assume that you can tell people whether or not their community “deserves” to exist based on your opinion of “justice.” But, if we’re deciding who “deserves” to live in their community, the mark of whether or not a community deserves to exist is not on the basis of some subjective “moral” thing. 

Does the system/community enhance the lives of or give better opportunities to the majority choosing to live in it than they would otherwise have in a state of nature? If yes, then the society “deserves” to exist. If no, then it will gradually cease to exist on its own.

Order is most important because once the socialization that results in things like honesty, trust, respect for rights, aversion to violence and theft, and fidelity is gone, no one can be happy. These people don’t get to hold society hostage with their, “if I don’t get what I want, I’m going to destroy society bs” and then have their demand met. The answer to that is “fine” and then a war for order and our values.

If the alternative is a nobody gets an important community member sent to jail and that ends up breaking the community, then get over it. Order is more important, more fragile, and more precious than the subjective “justice.”

Well, I mean, aside from that being pretty objectively terrible, it's also a fundamental misrepresentation of how a free country works and even the purpose of a society. If a community is so fragile that it is dependent on literal rapists and murderers to keep itself afloat, then it deserves to be trashed. Justice isn't subjective in a free country, its standard is based on the principles of civil and human rights and on the laws it upholds. That's what we call rule of law. It's where order comes from, and it's solely derived from and based on the consent of the governed, not "older order". You literally can't have order without justice and 2020 is a bloody and fiery safari through why that is.

Communities in free countries can't be propped up on the shoulders of prominent community members who can, by your reasoning, use their status to get away with doing whatever they want, that's insane. That defeats the purpose of even having a community.

Justice is always more important than order because it's what makes it possible to have order and peace in the first place.

Prioritizing the rights of victimized individuals over their abusers is vitally important to protecting order even if you disagree with that specifically to protect the stability of the community anyway. Turns out, allowing community members to rape and abuse and kill each other destabilizes communities and breaks down social order. Who knew

I can’t imagine just deciding to be permanently aggrieved and obsessed with something traumatic rather than choosing to move on from it.

Well, that's what I mean when I say you need to stop being selfish and learn to emphasize with these people: they're not doing anything wrong by feeling a certain way, and criticizing them for being traumatized is doing nothing but pissing them off even more. Like it or not, there's about 50+ million of them that share this great land and you have to learn to get along with them if you want to continue having a country, and I say that for better or for worse.

body:
Eh, I can see why you get that idea.

I was talking in context of political beliefs. There is no one right way to run a country. I was trying to encourage OP to NOT blindly align himself with one side or another; I think the best way is to examine each proposal and decide what works for you in context of your morals, values, what you think politics should do, how you think society should be organized etc.

I was also trying to discourage him from demonizing any particular political belief (though I was thinking of non-extremist beliefs), because that keeps you from having an open mind and when you're trying to form a political worldview it's important to have an open mind IMO.

post.title: Is anybody else tired of all of the propaganda?

body:
The problem is that there's been so many lies that people have accepted as true, so now if you wanted to tell someone that something is fake they weigh it up against all the others things that would also end up being fake, and they come to the conclusion that there's "no way I was wrong about ALL of that", simply put people don't think they can be manipulated, and when you tell them they have been they immediately get defensive as if you're attacking their character or intelligence.

Indoctrinating people is easy if you control what they hear, even if they have the source video they may not know what to make of it, so they'll fall back on the opinions of people they've trusted for so long and believed for so long. Thus the media can tell people what to think about each thing, something contradicts your world view? Don't worry, this 'trustworthy' news source with clear up that problem. All of the propaganda is horribly divisive, and if you see it for what it is you're essentially outcasted from the herd of people who were happily living in ignorance.

This is actually one of the reasons why the media refuses to acknowledge anything positive that Trump does, because to acknowledge one thing breaks the image of him being the 'bad guy' that he's been painted to be for so long, anything good he does will either not be talked about at all or framed in a negative light.

parent.body:
One of my best friends, someone I previously thought was intelligent and well informed, posted some bullshit about cultural appropriation. So I called her out on it, showed her a video of real native Americans explaining why they don't find it offensive and find it more insulting that the representation they're proud of is being systematically removed by the left. 

Her response? They all have Stockholm syndrome. No joke, that's the kind of bullshit she'll tell herself to avoid confronting her indoctrination. I am so disappointed in what she's become.

parent.body:
You aren't entirely wrong. I live in Finland, and a lot of black immigrants have come here in recent years. Since then, the amount of murders rapes and insecuriry in general have increased. Sweden is in similar situation but worse. There are already places where policemen are too afraid to go. And Finland will be in same situation if we don't do anything.

The media in Finland is mostly biased. It downplays the crimes of black people or does not report about them at all. At the same time, they report about small racist hate speech cases. The situation isn't the worst possible, but we still need neutral media.

I'm not saying all black people are bad, but it seems like Finnish media and government treat them much better that whites. In my opinion, if an immigrant commits a serious crime, like a rape or a murder, they should be deported.

Sorry for only talking about the situation of Finland, I'm not too familiar with America's situation other than the 13% 50% thing.
